content:
Diagnosis:
Chordoid glioma of third ventricle, WHO grade II
Diagnosed March 2024 following partial resection
TTF1 and GFAP positive on immunohistochemistry

Previous medical history:
Migraine
Hypothyroidism

Current medications:
Dexamethasone 2mg daily
Levothyroxine 100mcg daily
Levetiracetam 500mg twice daily

Allergies:
None known

Current situation:
Completed fractionated radiotherapy 54Gy in 30 fractions on 15 April 2024

MRI brain 1 May 2024 shows good response with reduction in residual disease

I reviewed [redacted name] today who has completed radiotherapy to the residual chordoid glioma. She has tolerated treatment remarkably well with only mild fatigue and occasional headaches well controlled with regular paracetamol. Her initial presenting symptoms of intermittent confusion have completely resolved. Performance status remains 0. She has maintained good oral intake and weight is stable at 65kg.

Neurological examination today shows no focal deficits. Visual fields are full to confrontation. Cranial nerves intact. Power and sensation normal in all limbs. Reflexes symmetrical.

The plan is to commence steroid weaning, reducing dexamethasone by 0.5mg every 2 weeks. We will arrange follow-up MRI brain in 3 months' time and review her in clinic with the results. She understands to contact us sooner if any new neurological symptoms develop.

cancer_timeline.value: MRI brain shows good response with reduction in residual disease

patient_facts.value: Mild fatigue and occasional headaches well controlled with paracetamol
No focal neurological deficits, full visual fields, intact cranial nerves, normal power and sensation, symmetrical reflexes

status_updates.value: WHO grade II chordoid glioma of third ventricle treated with partial resection and radiotherapy. Good response to treatment with resolution of initial confusion symptoms
MRI shows reduction in residual disease, complete resolution of initial confusion symptoms
To commence steroid weaning, reducing dexamethasone by 0.5mg every 2 weeks
Review in clinic with MRI results in 3 months
